alert.note: Alert for San Diego (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 16 at 8:46AM PST until January 17 at 12:00AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in California... Santa Margarita River At Santa Margarita river at Ysidora affecting San Diego County. For the Santa Margarita River...including Santa Margarita river at Ysidora...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Santa Margarita River At Santa Margarita river at Ysidora. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 8.2 feet, 2,500 cfs. The river has reached monitor stage. Personnel begin regular patrols along the levee. At 11.2 feet, Minor flood stage, 8,000 cfs. Vandegrift Road has begun to flood downstream of the gage. Stuart Mesa Road closures can be expected. At 13.3 feet, Moderate flood stage, 17,000 cfs. Vandegrift Road is flooded for several miles downstream of the gage site. Stuart Mesa Road is flooded near the bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 AM PST Monday the stage was 11.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 11.4 feet late this morning. It will then gradually fall below flood stage this afternoon and evening. - Flood stage is 11.2 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.4 feet on 02/23/1998. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued at 3 PM PST this afternoon.
